alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:46AM EST until January 12 at 3:31PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, Chesterfield and City of Richmond Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Westham. * WHEN...From this morning to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Begin moderate flooding. Residences near gage threatened with some driveways under one to one and a half feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 14.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 03/14/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
